document.title: MDE 2020 College and Career Readiness Curriculum

9A76BED4DB2644A19851ADD81282A88D.description: Create a presentation that applies knowledge and understanding of an aspect of digital literacy/digital citizenship.

2B885EF5368F42D489BEAFDA0D56D929.description: Identify security measures that websites take to protect their users’ identities.

2E652B8EA8E94179AA5A1EE66EAD1B55.description: Discuss the characteristics and purpose of a strong password.

603E2D3791E04577B7B07A7C19D8D8CC.description:
Investigate security measures that can be taken to protect an individual’s identity.
h.	D

739C5CF9907740DFB4F21BC609A3FE9F.description: Explain how a digital footprint can impact college and career choices.

D0098644CE9D4F8290602303B7238811.description: Explore the impact of an individual’s digital footprint.

A935C78410694B4A8EE0A3648B05F2C3.description: Demonstrate how to set privacy settings and update them on a regular basis.

454BC295FDF1472DB5983B4F2B2858D5.description: Compare the advantages and disadvantages of websites collecting personal data.

6A907648CFC848F8970E0AF810C42C3B.description: Identify ways in which websites collect personal data on its users.

9DB586B70A34404A9025C7CFCAC1F619.description: Explore the various facets of internet privacy.

7646118B00604AEE9F5D84062B1F461D.description: Identify resources that can assist with recognizing different types of licenses and copyright uses (e.g., Creative Commons).

3AFF16CAD6234A1BA1C8CAC14D560438.description: Evaluate copyright and plagiarism laws on others’ creative work.

04DD3D6717B049C98AC7DB12AF5C8893.description: Evaluate copyright and plagiarism laws on one’s own creative work.

81B2AFC9D9FA4FF7B0564BB65DBF2805.description: Investigate the impact personal social media accounts can have on college and career options.

4FDF7A5A07194EEBB6BF884D74EEB712.description: Analyze the advantages and disadvantages of social media sites/apps.

7B965237D9C840D2A6441B256B2A381F.description: Explore how social media sites/apps contribute to building online communities.

F5C530234FD440ACA213AF877AA0149F.description: Evaluate the impact of social media on digital communities.

8D53698D81174EB0AC2291F7F87F9309.description: Identify the responsible use of social media and how to apply it to individual social media accounts.

23685F8B74884A208D097BEFFFDB3208.description: Explain the importance of respecting other people’s opinions online.

2228401904F647808D563B0CDB26E36F.description: .	Discuss strategies that can be used to protect an individual’s online privacy.

7301B73E6B9145CF8118E58D28F6242A.description: Research state and national laws and policies concerning cyberbullying, cyberstalking, and other inappropriate online behaviors.

E6C6EBEA6A364D7193141FA20D511307.description: .	Analyze how cyberbullying, cyberstalking, and other inappropriate online behaviors can affect individuals and groups of people.

3B67A965541A4116B5B07451E8D33F56.description: .	Identify cyberbullying, cyberstalking, and other inappropriate online behaviors.

ECE74C1872734EBE98AD7E4A7D41EC0B.description: Demonstrate proper etiquette when collaborating, communicating, and using digital media.

FB5253EA6B46450F9D45C857DD2549A8.description: Explain the purpose of a professional email account and how to create one.

9A624ED8BF3C4F6983E9087C83606108.description: Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of various forms of media.

4362717ED79B42278AD0210138098B12.description: Explore the different ways individuals interact and integrate media into their daily lives.

51CB627AB9BF4916AB42A9B72C1FB0C6.description: Analyze how digital media influences and impacts society.

D953CF2214BE45ADB8B060DD10C83000.description: Compare the similarities and differences between digital communities and non-digital communities.

B10EBBDD41D04FC888A8919ED9E7D974.description: Discuss different types of media and how each is used to inform society (e.g., print, newspaper, broadcast, television, radio, talk radio, internet, etc.).

1FBF8EE04A824293B03E468DBA0810BF.description: Explain the role that digital media plays in an individual’s daily life.

02353619AC124576BEE0DC06389AA058.description: Present the final overall report to the selected portfolio committee (e.g., make a video, write an article, create a slideshow, etc.).

D7A6C7D538DC48C184AEB9604B3A708B.description: Write a report that includes a summary, key points, visuals, challenges, and recommendations for the service project.

BDC0C828A93C4D72812FF173FD544D18.description: Evaluate to determine if the project benefitted and created a positive environment for the local school/community.

7BC6F92D583240CF894F503BBA0FF1B2.description: Evaluate the success of the student service project.

4428AA4A09284BA28A259611EB559360.description: Maintain financial documentation of all aspects of the service project.

AD37BAAA6DA84E09A51D3E390729CAFB.description: Collect informational data on the progress of the project.

CF0B39E2BFB64661AE17B99511DE3CF0.description: Establish a consistent form of communication with volunteers, project participants, and staff involved in the project.

6668AFC43F8445879BD25719E3E8DE6B.description: Determine the roles and responsibilities of the service project work plan.

F6E0B4A4A92A43208C2ED35566784231.description: Implement a student-led service project into the school/community.

217ECD76865E4ABEBBC6FCB91CAF5739.description: Create a fundraising plan that will meet the fundraising needs for the project.

9BAC78361B0E4806B13C1C9A41B572D3.description: Explore external organizations/donors who can support and fund parts of the project.

8E31CE003AC24B518919979F4ABAF33B.description: Develop a budget that includes expenditures (e.g., marketing, transportation, materials, and supplies), income (e.g., donated goods/services, funds raised, and grants), and how all monies will be reported.

43295D4CDC21457899FF5B4C8D0F7A55.description:
Create a project work plan that details how the project will be fully implemented within a school/community. 
If funding is required…

AA8CC61F56A74FECA6BEB325527C0551.description: Explain how the project will benefit and create a positive environment for the local school/community involved in the project.

FD359381DC794CF2B2D12C578ABEDE77.description: Write and present a proposal for the selected service project to peers and selected staff.

00ACFE1E2F3C4D31BE6CC2D75A224D8C.description: Determine how the selected service project or projects will be implemented within the local school/community (e.g., the whole class/grade, an individual student, groups of students, etc.).

C9EF35B85E2D41B8AE3019F707A88CCD.description: Analyze potential service projects that would meet a need within the local school/community (e.g., children and schools, senior citizens, military, animals, environment, hungry or homeless, reducing crime, promoting safety, promoting community involvement or enhancement, maternal and child health, adult literacy, disease prevention and treatment, financial literacy).

C7D327F0655C4458A1620345691623FC.description:
Define community service.
•	Discuss what a community service project is and why it is important.
•	Explain the purpose of a service project and how it can impact a school or local community.

0BDEEAD9F1724CEAA8A70D0689F86C15.description: Determine a service project that will meet a need within the local school/community.

32968A5397BF4772AA2879D7D51260D9.description: Explain premiums, deductibles, copays, and out-of-pocket expenses.

D39283EE320D4BEB85803EBB36FF6482.description: Analyze the conditions under which it is appropriate for young adults to have life, health, disability, and long-term care insurance and identify sources to obtain each.

A992F0FEB14D4D3CA188895F1A3AF6B6.description: Explain the fundamentals of health insurance and identify various types of health insurance coverage.

25A2ABE7039B48BE8FDAF6060508386C.description: Identify the factors that influence the cost of homeowner’s and renter’s insurance.

E69BFE70974A42FEA013A86E73C4B3E3.description: Differentiate among the main types of auto insurance coverage and determine the legal minimum amounts of auto insurance coverage required in Mississippi as well as the recommended optimal amounts.

BACCDF6F604343FB9C92AE26D78BC1C4.description: Evaluate the costs and benefits of extended warranties.

CE5F1D2DFC9245768BB0EEA7C788BD07.description: Identify and discuss the basic types of insurance available to consumers and determine the appropriate time to utilize each.

2773AB5D880A490BA5B9C81490D67D48.description: Analyze appropriate and cost-effective risk management strategies.

D59FE21CB19948628A02448971274139.description: Explain the stock market, including the basics of how it functions, how investors interact with the stock exchange, and how investors make money in it.

B5DD3012813247FB8C88D98BADF1461E.description: Compare the consequences of delaying investment for retirement and the benefits of investing early.

9B2F67E058CD49D4909FC0A4482C8B22.description: Define asset allocation and diversification and explain why they are key strategies for successful investing.

7C1ADE232B6D4FBD9AFDF9C77F98872D.description: Compare the advantages of taxable, tax-deferred, and tax-advantaged investments for new savers, including Roth IRAs and employer-sponsored retirement vehicles.

7B0632481C1547A5A4F8D2C7EC89A8EF.description: Illustrate how the concept of time value of money applies to retirement planning.

BBADAD5BC6224649917095FCCA4DFE6D.description: Explain how compound interest works, its benefits to savers, and how to calculate it using an online calculator.

AD86D83FB3CF49BE84F7B44BAE83DAF0.description: Compare various types of investments and give examples of how employer-matching contributions to employer-sponsored retirement savings plans and vesting schedules affect participating employees.

125A06113A6545D68D7BF40C30E1C5A4.description: .	Describe the importance of various sources of income on retirement, including Social Security, employer-sponsored retirement savings plans, and personal investments.

D6A8BA12D1EB49CEBF5B4BE6BAE62DBB.description: Describe the differences between saving and investing and when to utilize each.

54C26A9F0C144A2C9359C423B75D17AC.description: Explain how investing helps build wealth and meet financial goals.

9DB67982D4664A249D09CD12377F40B2.description: Determine the most cost-effective option for purchasing a vehicle.

DF179AF8343B4B7D9E1C524904D5E006.description: Differentiate among various types of student loans and alternatives as a means of paying for postsecondary education.

047DEF1328144E518981C5CC364715CC.description: Discuss the relationship between compound interest and debt and its effect on wealth building.

FB17C7AFBB7C499DA9779B85626A019E.description: Analyze credit reports and credit scores.

0A392C5741704E59A37B4EAC3B5AAE5A.description: Examine a credit card statement and identify the interest rate and fees charged.

456699B17F3D4D1AAD558A17CC443BCA.description: Compare and contrast debit and credit cards.

30CD12E4E550423183474073470698BC.description: Explain the effect of debt on net worth and the ability to borrow money.

32D95A6E64934424B96480D917F7F4FE.description: Discuss the benefits and costs of using credit and debt.

C4953B61A9A64A4684621D20FBAA975F.description: Develop strategies to control and manage credit and debt.

CE759A8DC1FA42FC873142BCC5C08C5A.description: Develop a budgeting plan to manage spending and saving.

4BE4EE31DED54450BED568874EEF27A5.description: Identify common monthly bills and demonstrate how to schedule and manage bill payments.

39AFC0C30DB94EEEAF0365D7D9CB8813.description: Compare the advantages and disadvantages of owning a house versus renting.

A7481762A6B14017B5EA5C5D3BF6186B.description: Compare the costs of cashing a check with various third parties, such as banks or credit unions, check-cashing services, and retail outlets.

D74930296EA94AD3939ED26FC5C41866.description: Discuss various banking activities used to make a purchase, make a deposit, and/or pay a bill (e.g., written check, ATM withdrawal, debit, person-to-person transaction, prepaid card, etc.).

3C6B5DB7D22D4997A37FBD939E96DB95.description: Identify ways to deposit and withdraw funds from a personal checking and/or savings account.

F370394940C345AA80D39B4E75420E34.description: Investigate account management services that financial institutions provide (e.g., banking apps, websites, mobile alerts, online bill pay, direct deposit, etc.).

C817613F421B4BFFB370451FD1944A80.description: Compare the features and costs of personal checking/savings accounts offered by different financial institutions.

AA11D088E19E43918481DD18D46F09C1.description: Analyze strategies to monitor income and expenses, plan for spending, and save for future goals.

7D6755E18B874A73915E8736C3184875.description: Discuss the importance of having a personal financial plan, including goals, a spending-and-savings plan, an investing plan, an insurance plan, a net worth statement, and an estate plan.

3FDC2C9EF10D4B07B82E87583C9E9D71.description: Develop a definition of wealth based on personal values, priorities, and goals.

35FC2FD0542B42ADA9FB4055F2465D22.description: Explain the process of resolving identity theft problems as recommended by the Federal Trade Commission and relevant financial institutions.

773F53A11D0D4921A6F6EA0D3C58F101.description: Describe how inflation affects financial decisions, including the price of goods and services.

FBEAF1375A964E0F8B9096425C703974.description: Investigate sources of up-to-date information regarding consumer rights and responsibilities.

C47BE5E0B42C4EAAA7FC809E558C4322.description: Evaluate reliable resources for financial advice or representation when making financial decisions, including consulting attorneys, tax advisors, and/or financial planners.

FEACEF33A5B446E9B77CCF137F37B9A0.description: Explain how personal financial decisions affect oneself as well as others.

FD514448454E4D0DA5317D4A6FEB76EC.description: Apply reliable information and systematic decision making to personal financial decisions.

F6155113BDCB464D899650251194468D.description: Complete a W-4 form, Mississippi Employee’s Withholding Exemption Certificate, and Form I-9.

D47F5892D2E7493F810AD21FED235174.description: Explain the purpose of income tax and how it impacts net income.

EECC4A61AF4A47C98F27BEBC3D556A6C.description: Identify the parts of a paycheck stub and describe the purpose of deductions.

CFC56F8F53D844349BC53FCE4D8BC796.description: Describe the relationship between gross and net income.

CFA725BF7C1648EF862C6FB6F879BA29.description: Compare the unemployment rates of workers with different levels of education.

5FDBDE0550B84DEEB979217C47A6C479.description: Identify non-income factors that influence career choice.

32D7C848EA364DC2AC11279F4D85F7F6.description: Analyze the monetary and non-monetary value of employee benefits in addition to wages and salaries.

10D38C72EED14DF187A4D89D9E4027EE.description: Compare sources of personal income and compensation and analyze factors that affect net income.

086FACEB5F824C7BA68AE0489A7EA152.description: Write a reflection that gives an overview of the internship or job shadowing experience. The reflection should also answer the questions:•	How will this experience influence the selected career pathway? •	How did this experience compare to previous ideas or views of the chosen career? •	How did this experience help identify personal strengths and opportunities for growth?

A25BA6ACD19C46B5A6113E7EB8FA3D8C.description: Submit internship or job shadowing experience evaluation forms.

526843C48E6A47FCA7C781F595CFEA55.description: Request a letter of recommendation from the internship or job shadowing experience.

1A73B42A84C2485698A67FB14C00349E.description: Complete and document internship/job shadowing hours within the chosen career field.

DE677CD31B3840B7AD70B4FA8F83A0F5.description: Identify work experiences that are beneficial to this selected career.

C09DF6433A4C4CFF8501A208A8E0FEAC.description: List the advantages and disadvantages of entering the selected career field.

DFD9CF5E703F4556879BE30EB368CBA3.description: .	Determine the current salary scale for the desired career.

163F7D3622234392A068513CE17604B1.description: Explain what this career looks like daily.

C8192E6A31354746A3E32BB55DB99311.description: Identify skills (technical, transferable, and/or “soft”) that are needed for the selected career field.

0B7BD0B5B72446B5A9514316B6917716.description: Schedule a meeting with designated school staff to plan and schedule internship/job shadowing hours and expectations.

5D34995DC5274E99B1A404F652448B49.description: Discuss the purpose of an internship, a career interview, and job shadowing experience and how participating can provide purposeful exposure to a researched career path.

B96D07DB8FB84E9ABEE3B39937BA6C9C.description: Distinguish between an internship, a career interview, and a job shadowing experience.

26EE957D3BFE4C49A55ECC7A32909AD8.description: Participate in an internship, career interview, or job shadowing experience in person or online that is related to a researched career field.

F8FB267BC59A49C6AD9EB873B80E48AC.description: Create a spreadsheet or flow chart showing the advancement of the chosen career path and track the cost of any additional education/certifications that could be required throughout this career or other related options.

8536EE374D214EAB95B922959C30C169.description: Determine the return on investment for the chosen career.

B4B39336D924425DA23FF8C4EB3A68C9.description: Research current and future job availability for the chosen career path based on location.

C3DF8DD51C68436FA1ED0CCB0A23AD79.description: Identify potential salary and employee benefits/compensations.

F18076E4622A4A928A3E168F3FDD21FB.description: Explore the technology used in this career/profession.

F6F9091312BB49D2824B3880CBBC8492.description: Determine the skills, education, and training that will be needed for this career/profession.

45C2EE1FB490417F9E26F7C053EE202B.description: Research a selected career path based on interests and program of study in a completed ISP (e.g., O*Net Online, Bureau of Labor Statistics Occupational Outlook Handbook).

9A70D1AE54CD45C19D0F89593004B450.description: Preparing for a Career and Internship

1A97B13E2BFD4F739249567106281718.description: Accept a financial aid package for a college/university through an online student account.

06B6912043BA470895B4B0149602DBAC.description: Review the “Cost of College” resources from Get2College. Complete the resources based on the chosen college/university.

9F82AE14BA564B118E913636A7ADA924.description: Review financial aid packages the semester prior to attending a college/university.

961B4F0843A344E9A69B278477A684B0.description: Complete any verification required from the college/university or the Mississippi Office of Student Financial Aid.

08F6600DE6104CF69616D0C03C1C2D43.description: 5.	Understand the financial aid award letter process.

71BD2A39D6B8441F8296E707F947E276.description: c.	Write a reflection of the interview process and determine strengths and areas of growth.

329770F9B2FE4BB39321FE2EA3F62AA0.description: b.	Participate in a mock scholarship interview with peers or instructor.

246435F9007B40D9A87192A228E2CF0D.description: a.	Identify and examine questions that may be asked during a scholarship/academic interview.

42E38A443A9B4C519938ACBAE70784D3.description: Participate in mock scholarship and academic interviews.

8838A0C35AB34632BB4D3AE2DD86EE27.description: Complete an application worksheet, including scholarship/financial aid deadlines and requirements to maintain each.

40AE606A7E66414E958E59636703410D.description: (Seniors Only ) Complete the Mississippi Aid Application between October 1 and March 31. (msfinancialaid.org)

3709DB8B7889414299AF01F43FDB4A7B.description: (Seniors Only) Complete the FAFSA between October 1 and March 31. (fafsa.gov)

B4735DD7FE1149FAA1F0CE430135489A.description: (Juniors Only) Apply for available private scholarships (national or local).

EBAD0AF4795D4D1494E70F8EA82A1A49.description: (Juniors Only) Use the EFC (Expected Family Contribution) calculator (Get2College) to determine eligibility for financial aid.

C252FB14335E44BB8C785C04359481AC.description: Determine eligibility for the Mississippi HELP grant and other scholarships (e.g., Mississippi Scholars) based on information obtained from a revised/completed ISP.

67816AB3EEE040C08982BF30D8B1498B.description: Create a Federal Student Financial Aid username and password (FSA ID) to be used for all Federal Student Aid applications such as, FAFSA, and Federal student loans.

2A886A24C0C2421EB2EC119CA3F50FDA.description: Explore Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) resources to gain an understanding of what it is, what it is used for, and why it is important. (FAFSA)

525E08224101466C8A4012586F9AF28B.description: Investigate the types of student loans, loan amounts, interest rates, repayment options, etc. (studentloans.gov

A77D55E4E2DB4755B905999FE7761502.description: Explore military options for college financial aid.

8110805AA55D48AC81EB793D0E865A25.description: Research available scholarships that will apply to selected academic or technical programs (e.g., outside scholarships, university or college scholarships, Mississippi aid).

48C2298B380541F8849E294AC01B2A2F.description: Calculate the amount of financial aid needed for selected colleges/universities using the financial aid calculators on each college/university website.

075C06ACEF8841119F255D47E152BCF8.description: Explain the difference between a scholarship, a student loan, a work-study program, and a Pell Grant as financial aid options and what order they should be used when applying to a college/university. Explore financial aid options that will apply for each selected college/university (e.g., scholarships, grants, the G.I. Bill, etc.).

2C65DE7DBA2845CCA4C4BC31916681C0.description:
Develop a college financial plan that identifies funding sources for, and sustainability for, each year required for a degree or certification in a selected academic or technical program. 

The following objectives can be met by following the College Planning Guide found in the online resource Get2College.

C6503303F498427F9733087B698018DB.description: .	Research college academic programs offered in the summer that align with interests and career paths.

D55EBD94D1A84F61B3C2A87B49222D7E.description: (Juniors Only) Prepare for a transition to college.

7C36458AA5EE4EE6B336FCB527C27718.description: Create a final draft of the essay for submission to the selected college/university.

9294D052A7124E3CAA90A1F09A081605.description: Create a draft of the college essay to be reviewed and edited by a faculty member or counselor.

5981B2D7C4DA4CB7A8E8B6859065F44D.description: Research and choose a relevant essay prompt.

389D12E1D45B466EBE2C19C24D382117.description: Identify the requirements of selected college/university admissions, program entry, and/or scholarship essay (e.g., relevant topics, word count, double spaced, font, header, and footer notes).

A5BAC441019D480EAF91D3D1F726FE83.description: (Applications that require essays) Develop a written essay to meet college admissions, program entry, and/or scholarship requirements.

604F861C757C4FA89002BFA4A7D066DE.description: (Seniors Only) Review the process required to request official documents that will be required and sent to selected colleges/universities (e.g., transcript, ACT score, fee waiver, etc.).

AA7391D62B5945FB992C61C3AB70A709.description: (Seniors Only) Complete an official application for selected colleges/universities. (It is recommended that students complete three applications—a reach, match, and safety.)

F471DF434FCE4A40A8A9114B20EF380B.description: Utilize admissions counselors from selected colleges to provide information on the application process and selection.

E61687F8681E456E904064A558C06286.description: (Juniors ONLY) Complete a mock application for review by a faculty member.

B0979D019E394B14A6AA302E3BA77FD0.description: Identify the documents needed to complete a college application (e.g., ACT scores, transcripts, admissions essays, résumés, recommendations).

85713EB13A0F441BB5121607EBB8DC17.description: Demonstrate the ability to complete college admissions applications.

2099FCEE68154032B0A97522C6D9F30E.description: Create a calendar of dates for enlistment/enrollment requirements for a selected military branch or ROTC.

3A9BA58F8E4042A1B3B58D084E24812B.description: Create a calendar of application deadlines for selected colleges/universities.

3516ABCF92804D6B9F60507C4215E1F0.description: Write emails to potential college/university admissions counselors to introduce the student and their interests as well as request information on scheduled events and activities.

24D090F94A9B4416B210F2BEEED300C2.description: Determine “cost of attendance” (COA) for each college/university selected (myintuition).

01ECFC9C522E4C5B929067AA542780AF.description: Compare admissions requirements for selected military branches or selected colleges/universities (e.g., ACT score, grade point average (GPA), essay, and recommendation requirements).

D7CB421DE9AB4034B9A3CECF98258D77.description: Select colleges/universities or military branches to research based on the ISP and career interests.

06114BE8D5104A0699D1D70C031B9F39.description: Create a student profile at Big Future or other selected resource to use in the college search.

C60BFE7CF7FE4FD8BE837CF58951DF22.description: Investigate potential colleges/universities or military branches based on the ISP and career interests.

1F77710E86E240EF89950DDFBCB80696.description: Write and address formal thank you notes to mail/hand deliver to the portfolio exhibit panel members.

6319D1D9F5E441E5A16FAB1861F5A80D.description:
Communicate effectively how selected artifacts demonstrate the items below.
•	Evidence of self-reflection
•	Academic and social growth 
•	Leadership

88A1CBE3752941AAA60B0D7C5E98F957.description:
Communicate effectively how selected artifacts demonstrate the items below.
•	Proficiency of 21st century skills based on the portfolio rubric
•	Proficiency in academic standards
•	Preparedness for the chosen career pathway/postsecondary program of study

B4BEBC872DBF4833909F98F76C265ED0.description: Make strategic use of digital media (e.g., textual, graphical, audio, visual, and interactive elements) in presentations to enhance understanding of findings, reasoning, and evidence and to add interest.

3EE6D5EAB65942E48D27E060E737BD20.description: Present the final portfolio for evaluation.

4596C927429A443A85F4CC20F8390794.description: Write and prepare formal invitations to send to the selected/designated portfolio review panel.

20FABB1E2EEA48A9B8C9853528F17500.description: Schedule a date and time with the counselor and staff for the final portfolio exhibit.

6785B01E85F743F7B6BD17D4DF0F461A.description: Evaluate each artifact to ensure it demonstrates proficiency of 21st century skills.

6A2C0A17BB2147479B58DD4C6A7C9FEE.description: Evaluate progress for the completion of the final portfolio.

99D52D9224F04FB5AAE236874A2D2E4E.description: Create a collaborative calendar with teachers, counselors, and staff to determine when artifacts and written assignments for the portfolio are due throughout the year.

F237EFEB01FD4851A69FB19EFA39CD42.description: Write a reflection for each artifact that will be included in the final portfolio. (Sample reflection form can be found in Appendix B.)

568737CB3C164C7BB0FE89803C43FB9A.description: Collect and identify individual exemplary artifacts for the portfolio (e.g., academic assignments, writing samples, collaborative projects, job shadowing experiences, etc.) that will measure intended outcomes of 21st century skills and citizenship across subject areas and disciplines.

2C9192DA69AF462CADA4465B885FD50D.description: Demonstrate how to collect and organize exemplary artifacts into the student portfolio.

3146AD388F564DE78A69B0F0779CE2D7.description: Assess ways a student portfolio will demonstrate 21st century skills and knowledge from across curricula.

82928EBE8A044399A51C619D3E1D19C6.description: Identify and explain each component of a student portfolio.

B446B7EE88F44FFB89B95619CA93EC36.description: Explain the purpose of a student portfolio.

589D6AA8A76D40DFB4B222CD1D5DF811.description: Research online resources for career exploration options to prepare for a career, internships, and/or college or university (e.g., Get2College, MATT, and Big Future).

5BF1EF7709E84A5FB42DF3C064261C92.description: Complete an individual career assessment using an online resource (e.g., O*NET online).

144DED895CCE4A748ABE84F387DD3CA5.description: Discuss the differences between private, public, and religious colleges and universities regarding cost and requirements for admittance.

47E69A6420244E078FE3540C613D0B5E.description: Determine which college/university program of study or career pathway best meets the completed ISP.

015A147C94574AE38C5E1427DCB72995.description: Create or revise a student résumé that includes the items: Work experience (e.g., internships, job shadowing experiences, summer jobs, part-time work) ;Volunteering/community service projects; School information; Leadership activities: Extracurricular activities

436EFFAAB208490AB9827F1692DBEF7A.description: Evaluate postsecondary programs to determine progress towards meeting postsecondary/career goals.

F2125314C469477DBDD810C3FF8E22FC.description: Schedule a meeting with the high school counselor to complete the items:. Revise/complete an ISP to ensure requirements for the selected diploma are current and on track for graduation; Create a collaborative school year calendar of dates for student conferences/important deadlines for college, scholarship, and financial aid applications and portfolio artifacts.

8951180EF9D44CF3BBC5FD1F9ECE6DA1.description: Determine that all selected diploma requirements, based on the chosen career, are current and postsecondary plans are developed.

C07281A37B674BE6BAFC74CF39265227.description: Create a mission statement for the current school year that includes the items: Personal S.M.A.R.T. Goals; Academic  S.M.A.R.T. Goals; How the personal and Academic goals relate to 21st Century Skills; How the Created goals represent the individual student

0CF29EDF99AC4C358ED95E41F75AE0FA.description: Write S.M.A.R.T. goals for the current year and postsecondary that align with the current Individual Success Plan (ISP).

0C5872F615654390B9F9C103C2BFA83E.description: Create academic and personal S.M.A.R.T. goals for the current school year.

3B1B0AD9789F4024AA1CAA88A5CA49D2.description: Distinguish between hard skills and soft skills and how they apply to postsecondary and the workforce.

201C785DA20C4233A6B08A9914AE96D1.description: Explain and illustrate what 21st century skills are and why they are needed to be college- and career-ready.

204CECE413F14DD8B935CBD6D537A90E.description: Explain what it means to be college- and career-ready.
